Job Description
  MSO Automation Advanced Process Control (APC) team is looking for highly motivated Software Development professionals with a background in Semiconductor manufacturing, to design, develop, test, debug and validate software applications used for automating process control in Intel's advanced fabrication sites globally. APC applications are deployed in an Integrated Factory Automation environment interacting with other mission-critical/high availability automation services, hence quality and reliability is paramount to our development philosophy. Development may span the full application stack including both frontend and backend application development. The developer uses modern software development methodologies and programming languages, follows secure coding practices and software legal compliance guidelines, analyzes user requirements, writes both functional and test code, automates build and deployment procedure, and performs unit integration and end-to-end testing for the applications. Completes SDL (Software Development Lifecycle) tasks and collaborates extensively with other automation organizations for development, packaging, and installation tasks as well as interacts with end users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications needed per pilot testing in a high velocity, high quality environment. Additional responsibilities include but not limited to: � Reports out to Project management leads on application release timelines and support issues. � Provides training for customers on new application capabilities and documents them in our Internal knowledge capture systems. � Provides troubleshooting support for APC application issues in the factory and helps restore factory capabilities in a fast and efficient manner.
  
  Qualifications
  Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Candidate must possess a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Computational Physics or related Engineering disciplines with 7+ years of experience or a Master of Science degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Computational Physics or related Engineering discipline with 3+ years of experience or PhD degree with Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Computational Physics or related Engineering discipline with 1+ years of experience � Experience working in a semiconductor factory and process related domain knowledge � Experience working with writing and developing performant SQL queries and scripts for Oracle dB, use of PL/SQL and ODP .NET in application development � Experience in two or more of the programming and scripting languages: Matlab, XSLT scripting, Python, C++ and C# � Proficiency with source control tools (i.e. Github, Gitlab or TFS) and performing code contributions and reviews through those tools � Experience working with developer automation, CI/CD (continuous integration/continuous deployment) pipelines, and automated testing � Working knowledge of data structures and algorithms � Experience with systematic troubleshooting and root cause analysis to address and resolve application performance issues and replicate in development environment for debugging in widely used IDEs preferably Visual Studio � Experience with Windows Application development using WCF in C#/ .NET for High Availability services and Framework development Preferred Qualifications: � 2+ years of experience working in a semiconductor factory and process related domain knowledge � 2+ years of experience in Matlab, Python and C# � 2+ years of experience with control systems, linear optimization methods and simulations � Advanced knowledge of data structures and algorithms Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

Employees in the Technology Development and Manufacturing Group are part of a worldwide network of design, development, manufacturing, and assembly/test facilities, all focused on utilizing the power of Moore’s Law to bring smart, connected devices to every person on Earth.

positionName: Site Reliability Engineer - Software Development Engineer
description:
Our Company 

 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! 

 Our Company 

 Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

 We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours. 

 The Opportunity 

 Do you thrive on solving hard problems at scale? Do you want to build cloud-native systems that work seamlessly across devices? Are you interested in defining the future of creativity by making it fast, fun, and frictionless to create sophisticated-looking content? Most of all, are you passionate about the next generation of users and building modern solutions for them that connect to leading social and digital platforms? 

 We believe that a modern design tool should be lightweight and easy to use, with low friction and amazing performance. We are reimagining the creative process powered through a highly collaborative experience that works seamlessly across multiple surfaces. 

 The challenge 

 We are seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our team of talented developers. You have to be very knowledgeable in patterns for infrastructure services, highly available systems and scalable web architectures. 

 Our Site Reliability Engineers work hand-in hand with a growing team of hardworking engineers, building out a new platform critical to Adobe’s effort to reimaging a highly collaborative creative process. SREs provide operational tooling and engineering support to create reliable, quick, and transparent services and supporting infrastructure. 

 A capable Site Reliability Engineer should have one main high-level objective : identify and solve complex problems through software. This is not a traditional sysadmin/operations role ( i.e. deployments, ticket work, dashboarding, monitoring, incident response). A significant portion of time (~50%) will be some form of programming/development work, preferably to solve self-identified problems. 

 If you’re looking to be part of a team that is building the future of design tools, welcome to Creative Cloud. 

 
What you will do:
 Ensure the highest level of uptime and Quality of Service (QoS) to Adobe’s customers through operational excellence 

 Embed with product teams to champion collaboration/partnership 

 Identify areas to improve service resiliency through techniques such as chaos engineering, performance/load testing, etc 

 Support and maintain globally distributed, multi-cloud (public and/or private) environments 

 Automate common, repeatable tasks at large scale to streamline operational procedures 

 Design and maintain production monitoring systems 

 Identify and solve performance and stability issues using a variety of tools 

 Evaluate and manage application and environment security 

 Follow organizational change processes during implementations 

 Use and maintain version control for application infrastructure 

 Cross-train with other global team members 

 Participate in an on-call rotation as required 

 Determine root-cause for all production level incidents and write corresponding high-quality RCA reports 

 Promote the DevOps/SRE mindset 

 
What you need to succeed :
 5+ years production level experience with distributed applications at scale in public cloud (AWS and/or Azure) 

 Production level expertise with Docker, containerization orchestration engines ( i.e. Kubernetes) 

 Good experience in building and managing infrastructure on AWS cloud using various AWS services (EC2, IAM, S3, Route53, Cloudfront , SQS, EBS, KMS, Cloudwatch etc ) 

 Deep understanding and hands-on on Jenkins/GitHub/Docker/Kubernetes/ ArgoCD /Helm Charts. 

 Expertise in DevOps tools, GitOps process, and proficiency in CI/CD pipelines. 

 Strong understanding and hands on experience on observability (Metric, Logs, Traces) – Prometheus, Grafana, NewRelic , Splunk, etc 

 Experience in IAC tools Terraform 

 Monitoring & scaling the infrastructure, collaborating with other team members to develop automation strategies and deployment processes. 

 Implementing and handling the security compliance of infrastructure. 

 
Bonus : Chaos & resilience engineering concepts & experience. 

 Experience in one (and preferably more) of the following languages: Javascript (NodeJS ),Python , Java, Go. 

 Experience working within software development, particularly in the context of a SaaS offering. 

 Capable of leading change in a diverse organizational landscape 

 Strong written and oral communication skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with engineering management, developers, and leadership 

 Adapt to new technologies and learn quickly 

 B.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience 

 A good sense of humor! 

 
Desired Qualities:
 Standout colleague 

 Self-starter requiring minimal direction 

 Ability to learn quickly and adapt to changing priorities and requirements
